intro: Torenia pierreanoides, commonly known as the dwarf torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Torenia pierreanoides is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and hanging baskets due to its ornamental value.
